class_notes: (Concurrent Listing from Emory Law) (Meets January 19-April 26; ONLINE:  synchronous live sessions Monday and Wednesday 8:45am-10:15am)
course_description: An introduction to the basic concepts and institutions of Islamic Law, the foundation for the legal system of a large number of countries where Islam is the dominant religion, ranging from North America through the Middle East to Indonesia.
sections: Class Nbr: 5595, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 8:45-10:15a, Instructor: R. Abdugafurov, Status: Open
